result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Joshua T Wegner was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt:
David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joshua T Wegner in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   
Agent Shannon Stydahar from DOC appeared in court.
Court to Address - DOC's request for revocation of conditional release plan.

Agent Stydahar presented statements and requests to withdraw her request to revoke the defendant's conditional release plan.
Agent Stydahar is also requesting the court approve the conditional release plan that was previously filed with the court on 08/11/16.
State and Defense are in agreement with the Request of DOC/Conditional Release Plan.

Court Grants - DOC request and Approves the Corrective Action Plan filed with the court on 08/11/16.
Court also allows the petition for conditional release plan to be withdraw.
Defendan to be released from custody - FORTHWITH.
All placement orders have been previously signed and filed.

September 6, 2016,  Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting to be sent to Rogers Memorial Hospital.
09/06/16 - Court Reviewed - No action taken at this time.

Clerk spoke with agent Shannon Stydahar, Dept. of Corrections, and she advised that the County of Waukesha does not want to take defendant, but they are making sure he is receiving his medications while in custody and have reached out and contacted the Jail's nursing staff to provide defendant his medication. Therefore, she is ok with defendant remaining at the Waukesha County Jail. Judge Dreyfus is in agreement and defendant to remain at Waukesha County Jail as long as he continues to receive medications. Clerk left Atty Kershek a voice mail on 9/1/16 advising him that defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail and he is to notify court in writing if the jail stop providing medication to defendant.

Order to Transport, filed in court by DOC.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, on 08/29/16.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.
Hearing on September 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court, defendant Joshua T Wegner not in court, in custody.  
Agent Shannon Stydahar from DOC appeared in court.

Court was to address a Conditional Release Plan - However, based on the defendant's conduct in the interim, DOC is looking to revoke his Conditional Release Plan.
Defendant was taken into custody on the 08/23/16 (revocation hearing will need to be scheduled on or prior to 09/22/16).
DOC is still pursuing a revocation of the Conditional Release Plan.

Defense requests the defendant be transferred to Mental Health so they could administer his medications.
DOC has no objections.
Court will order the confines of the jail to be extended to the Waukesha County Mental Health Facility.  Defendant is to be transferred - FORTHWITH - Defendant not to be release without specific permission of the court.
Court Signed Order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.

  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
